result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Duane Southard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard Duane Southard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard Duane Southard was found guilty of Possession of THC [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Duane Southard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed by DOC. Requesting electronic copy of JOC. Sent on 10/29/2015. km
c: Def, Atty, DA, Roberts PD & Jail. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski DF: Richard Duane Southard appeared via phone. Case called 3:30. DE is in custody in Dodge Correctional Facility. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC  to amended Ct 1 dismissing the repeater in 15CF43 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 dismissing the repeater in15CF43. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2, 3 in 15CF43. Sentencing arguments. DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives appearance. Crt orders:
- 3 days St. Croix County jail
  credit for 3 days time served
- Court will suspend costs at this time. 
Court informs DE on his rights to appeal.
Prison Plea. Filed by Atty Kucinski. km
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 25, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski DF: Richard Duane Southard did not appear. Case called at 4:01. DE is in custody in Dodge. DE may appear by phone.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on June 2, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Richard Duane Southard did not appear. Case called at 4:22. Court reviews file. ADA Nieskes updates the court. If it is a plea to a misdemeanor the DE can appear by phone. Bond continues in form and amount.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2015 at 04:30 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Richard Duane Southard did not appear. Case called at 9:46. DE believed to be in custody. DE has other matters pending in other jurisdictions. DE may appear by phone at next hearing. Bond continues in form and amount. Atty. Kucinski continues to waive any and all time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 1, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski DF:  Richard Duane Southard did not appear. Case called at 2:36. Atty. Kucinski updates the court DE is in custody and requests phone appearance. ADA Nieskes agrees. Court authorizes appearance by phone for DE.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Kucinski. Reviewed by SRN. km
Preliminary hearing on February 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Richard Duane Southard appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Prelim demanded. ADA Nieskes requests $1000.00 cash bond, Atty Kucinski argues. Defendant is on a PO hold. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
